title: Astra Requests NASDAQ Extension, Considers Reverse Stock Split To Avoid Delisting
summary: Astra has submitted an application to Nasdaq for an additional 180-day period to comply with the minimum bid price requirement.

title: Astra outlines its plan to avoid Nasdaq delisting, including possible reverse stock split
summary: Spacecraft engine manufacturer and small rocket builder Astra on Thursday outlined a plan to avoid having its stock delisted from the Nasdaq.

title: NASA Selects 21 New Learning Projects to Engage Students in STEM
summary: NASA is awarding more than $3.8 million to 21 museums, science centers, and other informal education institutions for projects designed to bring the excitement of space science to communities across the nation and broaden student participation in STEM (science, technology, engineering, and mathematics).

title: NASA AIM Earth Orbiter Mission Ends Following Battery Issues
summary: After more than 15 years of operation, NASA’s Aeronomy of Ice in the Mesosphere (AIM) spacecraft has ceased operations due to battery issues.

title: NASA Awards Advance 3D Printing, Quantum Tech for Climate Research
summary: New technology is a key to helping NASA advance its long-term exploration goals for the benefit of all. To support its effort, the agency announced Thursday it will create two new institutes to develop technology in critical areas for engineering and climate research.

title: Rocket Lab to launch pair of Capella satellites from Wallops
summary: Rocket Lab, which opened its 2023 campaign with the inauguration of its first US-based launch pad, is preparing to launch its second consecutive mission from Launch Complex 2 at NASA’s Wallops Flight Facility in Virginia. Liftoff of the “Stronger Together” mission is currently set to occur at the opening of a two-hour window at 6:00 PM EDT (22:00 UTC) on Thursday, March 16.

title: NASA Awardees to Develop Sustainable Aviation Composite Tech
summary: NASA has issued $50 million in awards to 14 organizations to develop manufacturing processes and advanced composite materials for aircraft structures. These green technologies hold the potential to help reduce aviation carbon emissions.

title: Investing in Space: Don’t panic
summary: The past week has felt a little crisis-heavy.

title: LEO constellations are starting to disrupt GEO capacity contracts
summary: Satellite broadband customers are increasingly demanding shorter-term contracts to hold out for better prices in a market set for a flood of low Earth orbit capacity, according to executives of regional satellite operators.

title: SpaceX supply ship docks at International Space Station
summary: A day-and-a-half after launching from Florida, SpaceX’s Cargo Dragon spacecraft docked at the International Space Station at 7:31 a.m. EDT (1131 GMT) Thursday to deliver fresh food, experiments, CubeSats, and a suite of U.S. military tech demo payloads.
